title: Constructive Approach to Students’ Error Processing in E-learning Courses

abstracts.content: Well-designed and personalized interactivity is critical in ensuring effective e-learning outcomes. This paper proposes an approach to processing students’ errors and designing interaction based on the error categories and their causes. The method of processing conceptual and procedural errors has been proposed and shown on the examples extracted from the financial management e-course. The main contributions of the article concern the possibility of using the domain ontology and inference rules to design intelligent interactions in response to students’ errors. The implementation solutions in the Moodle environment using external tools have also been highlighted.

title: The Case Study of Inventive Methods to Search for Creative Solutions - Based on Work by John Maxwell Coetzee

book.title: Interdyscyplinarność, czyli współczesne wyzwanie dla naukowców. Cz.9

title: The effectiveness of the implemented inventory  management method - case study of a manufacturing company

abstracts.content: One of the basic factors influencing the functioning of production enterprises is the correct inventory management. There are many methods that have been analysed and improved in recent years, but they often differ from company practices. In addition, technological development that allows for production support forces enterprises to take specific actions in the area of warehouses and inventory management. The article presents considerations on selected aspects of inventory management and analyses this element in a selected company. An analysis of the purchases of strategic raw materials in the last months in connection with the invasion of Ukraine and the reduced availability of production materials was also presented.

title: Efficient Lightweight Multimodel Deep Fusion Based on ECG for Arrhythmia Classification

abstracts.content: An arrhythmia happens when the electrical signals that organize the heartbeat do not work accurately. Most cases of arrhythmias may increase the risk of stroke or cardiac arrest. As a result, early detection of arrhythmia reduces fatality rates. This research aims to provide a lightweight multimodel based on convolutional neural networks (CNNs) that can transfer knowledge from many lightweight deep learning models and decant it into one model to aid in the diagnosis of arrhythmia by using electrocardiogram (ECG) signals. Thus, we gained a multimodel able to classify arrhythmia from ECG signals. Our system’s effectiveness is examined by using a publicly accessible database and a comparison to the current methodologies for arrhythmia classification. The results we achieved by using our multimodel are better than those obtained by using a single model and better than most of the previous detection methods. It is worth mentioning that this model produced accurate classification results on small collection of data. Experts in this field can use this model as a guide to help them make decisions and save time.

title: Advances in Distance Learning in Times of Pandemic

abstracts.content:
The book Advances in Distance Learning in Times of Pandemic is devoted to the issues and challenges faced by universities in the field of distance learning in COVID-19 times. It covers both the theoretical and practical aspects connected to distance education. It elaborates on issues regarding distance learning, its challenges, assessment by students and their expectations, the use of tools to improve distance learning, and the functioning of e-learning in the industry 4.0 and society 5.0 eras. The book also devotes a lot of space to the issues of Web 3.0 in university e-learning, quality assurance, and knowledge management. The aim and scope of this book is to draw a holistic picture of ongoing online teaching-activities before and during the lockdown period and present the meaning and future of e-learning from students’ points of view, taking into consideration their attitudes and expectations as well as industry 4.0 and society 5.0 aspects. The book presents the approach to distance learning and how it has changed, especially during a pandemic that revolutionized education.

It highlights

• the function of online education and how that has changed before and during the pandemic.

• how e-learning is beneficial in promoting digital citizenship.

• distance learning characteristic in the era of industry 4.0 and society 5.0.

• how the era of industry 4.0 treats distance learning as a desirable form of education.

The book covers both scientific and educational aspects and can be useful for university-level undergraduate, postgraduate and research-grade courses and can be referred to by anyone interested in exploring the diverse aspects of distance learning.

title: Business Process Management –The Perspective of Polish Banks and Insurance Companies

abstracts.content:
The modern economy is subject to a dynamically progressing process of change, which causes that the service sector, the so-called servitization. In highly developed countries, 70% of gross national income comes from the services sector. In Poland, more than half of the companies (52.5%) conduct service activities. The service sector is one of the most important and fastest-growing sectors of the Polish economy – both before and during the COVID-19 pandemic, and its role will probably increase after the end of the pandemic.
Along with the growing importance of services, the importance of service enterprises is growing. Servitization generates demand for services, which along with the development of IT solutions, on the one hand, gives service enterprises a chance to develop, expand their activities, increase profits, and on the other, puts the customer and his requirements in the center of their interest, which implies powerful competition and related challenges. The customer is not only a consumer, but also a prosumer who actively influences the portfolio of services offered and the ways of their provision. The high supply of services determines the growth and change of requirements of customers who often expect an individualized offer and the simplest form of its implementation. The personalization trend is developing, according to which the customer and his needs are placed at the center of the sales and service provision process. Service companies must be directly oriented to their customers and their requirements, remain in a constant relationship with them. The COVID 19 pandemic has posed many challenges to organizations providing services and forced them to change their business processes and the IT solutions they use. Moreover, these changes had to be implemented very quickly. The search for new management concepts and strategies that could meet modern conditions is particularly justified in relation to service enterprises. One of the elements should be an agile and effective management model, integrated with IT systems, which will provide opportunities to meet market requirements, try to anticipate them and create a new offer based on innovative solutions. There are theoretical and practical reasons for the model to be based on a process approach. The process approach is considered the most widely and most frequently used approach to management, both in practice and in theory. The desired result is achieved with greater efficiency when activities and related resources are perceived as a process. The process approach directly affects work efficiency and the degree of achievement of the assumed goals. A company that does not focus on its customers and its processes that create value for them will not stay on the market for long. In order to ensure the conditions for existence and development, organizations must improve their processes, structures, organizational culture and adapt to external requirements resulting from the environment in which they operate. The focus should be on external and internal customers and the value creation chain focused on them. The application of the process approach in service enterprises ensures positive effects for the enterprise itself and its clients.
                    The analysis of the application of business process management in service enterprises is particularly interesting in the context of enterprises providing banking and insurance services. The banking sector is considered the most technologically advanced service sector in Poland. In turn, the insurance sector is undergoing a dynamic digital transformation aimed at optimizing business processes. The COVID-19 pandemic significantly accelerated the development of digital sales channels in banks, already advanced compared to other sectors. Many of them closed or shortened the opening hours of branches, while implementing new digital functionalities, including fully remote account opening, remote identification and verification of customers and contactless payments. In the insurance sector, the pandemic intensified the development of many IT systems that were at an early stage of development. Insurance companies have been obliged to adopt hybrid-digital solutions by incorporating virtual advisors, video conferencing and online chats. Analyzes of the Polish Bank Association and Accenture indicate that there is a growing interest in digitizing business processes using cloud computing. The importance of the cloud for the banking and insurance sectors is confirmed by the guidelines and recommendations published by the Polish Financial Supervision Authority and the Polish Insurance Association.
The article presents considerations on the legitimacy of using business process management in service enterprises. The authors also present the results of research conducted among selected service enterprises of the Polish banking and insurance sector.

keywords: Business Process Management as a Service
Business Process Management System as a Service
Process of Business Process Management as a Service

title: Cloud Computing and Business Process Management: Possibilities, Challenges, New Concepts

abstracts.content:
Modern companies must constantly evolve, adapting to a turbulently changing environment. This evolution, determined by
the very rapid development of technology and the possibility to use it, implies new forms of doing business, customer contact, service provision and product delivery. Business models and practices that have worked so far are no longer able to provide an adequate framework for maintaining effective and efficient business operations. Business process management is a response to, among other things, the increasing turbulence of the business environment and the individualization of customer needs and expectations. A dynamically developing and widely used model for the provision and use of IT solutions is cloud computing. Business process management using cloud computing is a solution that can help service companies face the accompanying challenges.
The article presents the practical possibilities of business process management using cloud computing, the challenges and
the way forward. As a first step, the article presents the potential of business process management using cloud computing in the context of enterprise needs. This is followed by an explanation of the basic concepts and a presentation of the practical possibilities of business process management using cloud computing services. The final part of the article presents the directions of development of business process management in the calculation cloud and the concept of a new service:
Business Process Management as a Service.

title: Zarządzanie zasobami - dobór pracowników w procesie rekrutacji

abstracts.content: Tematem przewodnim niniejszego rozdziału jest proces rekrutacji i dobór pracowników w oparciu o przeprowadzoną ankietę wśród wybranej grupy pracodawców. Istotnie pozyskanie personelu wydaje się jednym z kluczowych elementów w kontekście sprawnej polityki firmy, bowiem odpowiedni dobór pracowników stwarza warunki do efektywnego rozwoju, zarówno dla pracodawcy, jak i pracownika. Cel podjętych badań to analiza elementów i czynników, jakie brane są pod uwagę w kontekście procesu zatrudnienia. W rozdziale podjęto próbę analizy następujących kwestii: Jakie są oczekiwania pracodawcy względem potencjalnego pracownika – w kontekście osobowościowym i merytorycznym (wiedza, doświadczenie, kompetencje)? Czym kieruje się pracodawca, zatrudniając pracownika – wykształceniem, doświadczeniem zawodowym czy sukcesami? Za pomocą jakich metod pracodawca poszukuje pracownika? Jak wygląda profil kandydata, który wzbudza zaufanie w kontekście zatrudnienia? Jaki jest schemat działań rekrutacyjnych? Analiza powyższych kwestii na pewno ułatwi dokonanie najlepszego wyboru w procesie rekrutacji, zmniejszając ryzyko wyboru osób nieodpowiednich na dane stanowisko.

The main topic of the following paper is the recruitment process based on questionnaire among the group of employers. It ought to be said that the selection of employee seems to be one of the most significant elements in the context of the effective development, not only for employers, but also for employees. The aim of the searching is to present what elements and factors are taken into consideration in the process of employment. As the authors of the paper, we would like to answer the following questions: what expectations are for the potential employee – in the context of personality and knowledge/experience/skills? What is the most important – education, experience or success? What methods are used in the searching for employees by employers? And finally, what is the model of recruitment?

book.title: Otoczenie współczesnych organizacji - szanse i wyzwania nowej normalności gospodarczej

title: Cloud ERP – characteristics and main directions of development

abstracts.content:
ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems are widely used in various types of enterprises to support
management and streamline the implemented business processes. Currently, ERP systems streamline
both internal business processes and those occurring in the immediate environment of the enterprise, i.e.
those carried out jointly with providers and customers. ERP systems, by integrating all processes and
also supporting the circulation of data and documents, facilitate the implementation of strategic objectives
and play a key role in the digital transformation of enterprises. ERP systems can be acquired and operated in the on-premise model (relying on the customer's own IT resources) or in the Cloud Computing
model (using the ERP system in the form of a paid e-service made available on the provider's IT infrastructure). In recent years, there has been growing interest in ERP systems offered in the Cloud
Computing model (Cloud ERP), as their ease of implementation, lack of need for in-house IT infrastructure and low input costs mean that smaller companies can also benefit from this class of systems.
Currently, almost all providers offer ERP systems in the Cloud Computing model. The purpose of the article is to identify the trends and directions of development of Cloud ERP systems. In order to realize the purpose of the article, the characteristics of Cloud ERP systems were briefly presented beforehand.

title: Effect of the Rolling Process on the Properties of the Mg/Al Bimetallic Bars Obtained by the Explosive Welding Method

abstracts.content: This study aims to analyze the influence of the rolling process on the microstructure and corrosion properties of the Mg/Al bimetallic bars obtained by the explosive welding method. The bars investigated were rolled using two different types of rolling: classical rolling (Variant I) and modified rolling (Variant II). Two different temperatures (300 °C and 400 °C) for each of the variables were applied as well. In this study, rods with an aluminum plating layer constituting 16.8% of the cross-sectional area and an average thickness of about 0.93 mm were investigated. Based on the revealed results, it was found that after the rolling process, the material shows clearly lower values of both icor and current in the passive range. In the joint zone of Mg/Al rods rolled at 400 °C, Al3Mg2 and Mg17Al12 intermetallic phases are distinguished, localized next to the Mg core, and characterized by columnar, coarser grains. In the transition zone closer to the Al layer, only the Al3Mg2 phase is revealed, characterized by a refined, small grain size.

title: THE CONTENTS OF INORGANIC COMPONENTS IN SELECTED POLISH AND ROMANIAN HERBAL TEAS INFUSIONS

abstracts.content: The aim of this study was to analyze the contents of the selected inorganic ions (F -, Cl -, NO3-, PO43-, SO42-, Na+, K+, Mg2+, Ca2+) and trace metals (Cr, Mn, Fe, Ni, Cu, Zn, Cd, Al, Pb, Co) in infusions prepared from popular herbal teas available in the Polish and Romanian markets. Ion chromatography with conductivity detection and microwave plasma-atomic emission spectroscopy were applied for this purpose. The experimental data were subjected to chemometric analysis to identify common traits and differences among them. Principal component analysis was employed to create a model using selected variables. The findings revealed that certain herbal teas exhibited elevated concentrations of potentially hazardous analytes, such as nitrate, cadmium, lead, and chromium. Based on these results, an assessment of the associated risk from these analytes was conducted.

title: Rola i znaczenie procesu selekcji pracowników jako współczesne wyzwanie dla organizacji

abstracts.content: Tematem przewodnim niniejszego rozdziału jest rola i znaczenie selekcji w organizacji, a celem podjętych badań jest analiza istoty selekcji jako klucza mającego na celu budowanie zespołu, który będzie dążyć do sukcesów w dynamicznym środowisku biznesowym. W rozdziale podjęto próbę analizy kwestii związanych z wyzwaniami i strategiami dla organizacji, które można obserwować w procesie selekcji potencjalnych pracowników. Problem badawczy i cel poszukiwań odnosi się do rekrutacji pracowników oraz wyboru najbardziej odpowiednich narzędzi i metod diagnostycznych oraz etapu przygotowań, realizacji i oceny końcowej w procesie selekcji.

The main topic of the following chapter is the role and essence of selection in the organization. The aim of the searching is to present the importance of recruitment as the key to build a team which would aim to success in the dynamic business environment. As the authors of this scientific we would like to pay attention to the issues associated with the challenges and strategies for organization which may be observed in the process of selection of potential employees. The scientific problem and the aim of our research is connected with the recruitment of employees and the choice of the most precious tools and diagnostic methods together with various phases of preparation, realization and the final review within the selection process.

book.title: Zarządzanie w dynamicznym środowisku biznesowym. Wyzwania i strategie dla organizacji

title: Adaptation of cloud computing in Polish Energy Companies

abstracts.content:
Nowadays, Cloud computing is a major trend in the IT market, changing the way businesses acquire, use and
pay for IT solutions to support their operations. Today, companies across the energy sector are increasingly
adopting cloud computing solutions (which mainly include IT infrastructure, software platforms and
specialized types of software with related services). The article, based on literature studies and analysis of
available research results, presents the state of cloud computing adaptation in Polish energy companies against
the background of the EU. Previous studies have indicated that energy companies were not leaders in the use
of cloud computing. Based on the analysis of statistical data, it can be concluded that the current level of cloud
computing adoption in energy companies in Poland is higher than in the EU. In addition, energy companies in
Poland have overtaken long-term leaders, i.e. IT and telecommunications companies, in terms of cloud
adoption. The article also identifies the levels of cloud computing adoption in enterprises from the energy
sector. In energy companies, cloud computing solutions are most often located at the basic, standard or
specialist level. In the final part of the article, examples of the implementation of cloud computing solutions
in energy companies are presented based on the distinguished levels of adaptation.

conferenceEdition.fullName: 43rd International Business Information Management Association Computer Science Conference

title: Cloud computing as a part of integrated process management approach

abstracts.content:
Integrated process management is a response to the challenges of management in modern enterprises
determined by many changes. The concept is based on the coherence of the process-project-knowledge
triad and the synergy between them, it is based on classic process management, while ensuring higher
efficiency and adaptation to changing environmental conditions. Implementation of the concept in practice
requires, for m.in, the use of an appropriate approach to process management based on IT solutions.
Literature, research and market practice indicate an increase in the use of cloud computing and the role it plays in business processes and IT architecture of enterprises of various sizes and sectors. The article
presents a synthesis of the authors' research and work on the use of cloud computing, an integrated
process approach and business process management using cloud computing

proceedings.title: Proceedings of the 44th IBIMA Information Systems Management Conference, 27-28 November 2024, Granada, Spain. Empower Businesses and Create Economic Development in Digital Future: Vision 2030

title: The Use of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) in the Management of the Innovative and Smart City
Initiatives to implement business process management solutions in organizations

abstracts.content:
Business process management plays a key role in the adaptation of modern organizations
to the dynamically changing market environment. This approach allows for a better
understanding of internal processes, their optimization and integration with modern
technologies, such as robotization, artificial intelligence or cloud computing. The article
presents key initiatives related to the implementation of process solutions in organizations,
indicating their importance in building flexible management structures. The presented research
results and practical guidelines can be a reference point for both companies already using the
process approach and those that are just planning to implement it. The dynamic development
of tools supporting business process management and the forecasted increase in the value of the
global market for these solutions emphasize their growing importance in effective management
of organizations. Implementing a process-based approach allows not only for better use
of resources, but also for increased innovation and the organization's ability to respond
effectively to new challenges. Future research should focus on analyzing the long-term effects
of implementing business process management and its integration with advanced technologies
to further understand its impact on organizational development

journal.title: Zeszyty Naukowe Politechniki Śląskiej. Seria Organizacja i Zarządzanie

title: Big data w marketingu - narzędzie doskonalenia relacji z klientami

abstracts.content: Jednym z podstawowych aspektów zjawiska big data, czyli przetwarzania masowych danych, są możliwości zastosowań jego technik w zarządzaniu. Ich potencjał różni się wyraźnie w zależności od specyfiki organizacji i obszaru jej działalności. Celem artykułu jest wskazanie specyfiki i kierunków zastosowań metod big data w zakresie marketingu, ze szczególnym uwzględnieniem doskonalenia relacji z klientami. W artykule przedstawiono ogólną charakterystykę zjawiska big data w kontekście zarządzania, opisano ewolucję analityki biznesowej związaną z nowymi możliwościami przetwarzania masowych danych oraz wskazano przykładowe obszary zastosowań big data w zakresie doskonalenia relacji z klientami, które potwierdzają tezę o wysokiej przydatności tych metod w marketingu.

title: Fast Estimation of Multidimensional Regression Functions

abstracts.content: Various methods for fitting an unknown functions from the set of noisy measurements are applicable to a wide variety of problems. Among them, the nonparametric algorithms based on the Parzen kernel are willingly used. In the article, we propose a novel and very effective numerical simplification in Parzen approach leading to a significant reduction in computation time. The algorithm is basically developed for multidimensional case. The two-dimensional version of the method is explained in details and analysed. Computational complexity and speed of convergence of the algorithm are studied. Some applications for solving real problems with our algorithms are presented.

conferenceSeries.fullName: International Conference on Control, Automation, Robotics and Vision

conferenceEdition.fullName: 17th International Conference on Control, Automation, Robotics and Vision (ICARCV)

title: Generic Dijkstra: correctness and tractability

abstracts.content: The recently-proposed generic Dijkstra algorithm finds shortest paths in networks with continuous and contiguous resources. The algorithm was proposed in the context of optical networks, but is applicable to networks with finite and discrete resources. The algorithm was published without a proof of correctness, and with a minor shortcoming. We provide that missing proof and offer a correction to the shortcoming. To prove the algorithm correct, we generalize the Bellman’s principle of optimality to algebraic structures with a partial ordering. By analyzing the size of the search space in the worst-case, we argue the stated problem is tractable. Thus we definitely answer a longstanding fundamental question of whether we can efficienlty find a shortest path in a network with discrete resources subject to the continuity and contiguity constraints: yes, we can.

title: UPROSZCZENIA POLITYKI RACHUNKOWOŚCI W ZARZĄDZANIU MAŁYM I ŚRED-NIM PRZEDSIĘBIORSTWEM W POLSCE
Business Process Management Systems and Cloud Computing - the Perspective of Polish Banks and Insurance Companies

abstracts.content: Business Process Management Systems (BPMS) provide the most mature and advanced support for Business Process Management (BPM). The use of cloud computing eliminates barriers faced by BPM and increases its potential. The analysis of BPMS and cloud computing systems is particularly interesting in the context of companies rendering banking and insurance services. The goal of this paper is to present the results of surveys concerned with BPM and cloud computing, conducted among selected 7 banks and 5 insurance companies operating in Poland. The article presents short discussion, conclusions and directions for further development of business processes management approaches with the use of cloud computing.
